data.name: OnlyMicrosoftGraphSupported
data.value: Currently only Microsoft Graph API email testing is supported

data.name: ProvideCompleteOAuthConfig
data.value: Please provide complete OAuth configuration and sender address

data.name: CannotGetAccessToken
data.value: Unable to obtain OAuth 2.0 Access Token. Please check:{0}1. Whether Tenant ID, Client ID, and Client Secret are correct{0}2. Whether the application has configured Mail.Send application permission (Application Permission){0}3. Whether the administrator has consented to this permission

data.name: AccessDeniedError
data.value: Insufficient permissions. Please confirm the following configuration:{0}1. Add 'Mail.Send' application permission (Application Permission, not Delegated Permission) to the application in Azure Portal{0}2. Click the "Grant admin consent for [Organization Name]" button{0}3. Confirm that the sender email address matches a user that the application has permission to send on behalf of{0}4. If using application permissions, the sender must be a user that the application has permission for{0}See: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/auth-v2-service

data.name: InvalidUserError
data.value: Invalid user: Sender email '{0}' does not exist or the application does not have permission to access. Please confirm the email address is correct and the application has permission to send emails on behalf of this user.

data.name: AccessDeniedSimple
data.value: Insufficient permissions. Please add 'Mail.Send' application permission (Application Permission) to the application in Azure Portal and have the administrator consent.

data.name: DefaultTestEmailBody
data.value: This is a test email to verify that the Microsoft Graph API email sending configuration is correct.
